creditline: The Marilyn C. Benson Endowment for Art Acquisition
description: cotton fabric screenprinted with repeating design of large bunches of tulips in red, pink, white with green and blue leaves on a deep blue background; length of unused fabric with two unfinished edges and two selvedge sides
markings: R edge near selvedge, stamped: Paule Marrot
text: Paule Marrot was a leading French textile designer and artist in the mid twentieth century. Her work was coveted by decorators and socialites throughout her long career. Marrot also made inroads for women designers in the automotive industry when she was contracted by Renault to design textiles for car interiors. “Tulipes” was created during a particularly fruitful period of Marrot’s career when she not only produced a large quantity of designs but earned national and international recognition by winning multiple prestigious design awards.
title: Les Tulipes (Tulips)
